alert.note: Alert for Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 2:09PM CDT until May 26 at 2:20PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC119-250715- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.W.0004.220525T1630Z-220526T1920Z/ /RIPO2.1.ER.220525T1630Z.220526T0000Z.220526T1320Z.NO/ 209 PM CDT Tue May 24 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Places along the Cimarron River valley in Payne County are briefly flooded. Agricultural lands and oil wells located near the channel are isolated by water in cutoff channels along the river valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
